result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge and assessments and DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.    Any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with codefendant Dominic Collins 14CF440.

Successfully complete a cognitive intervention program.
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Pay all supervision fees.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession; voting.
Provide DNA sample unless previously submitted, pay surcharge.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Anthony Kirk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order DENYING Motion for Eligibility for Substance Abuse Program signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for eligibility for Substance Abuse Program.

Certification of SENTENCING HEARING  transcript commencing 07/22/2014 received and filed. (61 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Institution.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
received and filed.  Parties notified.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant sworn in. 
AS TO COUNT 1 OF THE AMENDED INFORMATION  - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITHOUT a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Court vacated the jury trial date of 6/23/2014. 
Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-22-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Discussion regarding plea negotiations.  
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant wishes to plead guilty.
Defendant charged as follows: 
AS TO COUNT 1 Attempted Armed Robbery with Use of Force, Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(2),939.32, 939.05, a Class C Felony.

Defense counsel contacted the court.  Parties are still negotiating this matter and request a short adjournment.  Court does not object.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 6/23/2014 at 8:30 a.m.   Case is adjourned to Br 12 for final pretrial on 6/11/2014 at 8:30 a.m.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Parties in court.  Parties are still working on resolving this matter and request the final pretrial date be adjourned.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 6/23/2014 at 8:30 a.m.   Case is adjourned to Br 12 on 6/4/2014 at 1:30 p.m. 
  Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense request a trial date.  Defendant request for new counsel denied at this time.   Case set for final pretrial on 5/19/2014 at 8:30 am.  Jury trial set for 6/23/2014 at 8:30 am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4/4/2014; reply due: 5/2/2014.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.
Original Transcript  PRELIMINARY HEARING (19 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 11, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Washington-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Arraignment scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANDRE L., LASHUNDA M. OR CO-DEF: DOMINIC C.; THEIR FAMILIES, RESIDENCES OR WORKPLACES.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Jerome Anthony Kirk in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BOROWSKI, Branch 12.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
